ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Session time
Visit name
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project (used for source IDs that change depending on timepoint/visit/etc.)
Number of days ago
Number of drinks n_days_ago_p
Number of cigarettes n_days_ago_p
On days that you smoked a cigarette, how many cigarettes did you smoke per day on average?
Approximately how many days of the past month did you use cannabis?
Number alcholoic Drinks a Month
How many days did you drink last month?
Notes: ex1. if you drank 3 days a week, the answer should be 3X4 = 12 days; ex2. if you drank 10 days last month, the answer should be 10 days

ElementDescription: Number of drinks per day that you drank, in past month
Number of heavy episodic drinking days (5 or more drinks for men; 4 or more drinks for women) on a single drinking occasion per month
ALCOHOL: Maximum # of drinks consumed in one day.
In the past month, approximately, how many tobacco cigarettes have you used?
In the past month, on how many days did you smoke cigarettes?
Notes: Number of days; -5= Item seen but not answered; -9= Item skipped by show-if logic; -999= Data not submitted (incomplete, item not seen)

ElementDescription: Calendar Date
Number of standard drinks consumed on [tlfb_date]
Number of hours spent drinking on [tlfb_date]
